artist: Artist: Kawase Hasui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: landscape; figure carrying 2 buckets on a yoke over PR shoulder in LRC; 2 children playing by edge of water in LLQ; buildings around a small dam-like structure; dark water in background; moon in sky
inscription: LLC: 大正八夏 {Taishō hachi natsu} (Summer 1919)
markings: LLC, red round artist\'s seal: 巴水 {Hasui}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Souvenirs of Travel, First Collection (Tabi miyage dai isshū 旅みやげ第一集)
text: The series Souvenirs of Travel, First Collection, made in 1919 and 1920, consists of sixteen designs of locations in the north, central, and southeast of Japan’s main island, Honshu.
title: Mishima River, Mutsu
